Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Hotfix] Update banner message" (#8024) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened pull request "[Hotfix] Update banner message" (#8024) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Merged pull request "[Hotfix] Black Lives Matter" (#8023) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened pull request "Black Lives Matter" (#8023) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "Detect disconnected client when package upload fails and return 4XX" (#8022) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Bug description

When the client disconnects during package push (perhaps Ctrl + C on nuget.exe) we get an exception and return 500. Even though the client has disconnected, this gets recorded as a 500, affecting SLO/success metrics.

### Reproduction steps

1. Run latest gallery locally.
1. Push a very large package to your local gallery.
1. While gallery is reading the upload, terminate the upload on the client side.

### Expected behavior

A 400-level status code should be recorded since the client caused the error.

### Actual behavior

A `PackagePushFailure` metric is recorded and HTTP 500 is returned.

For recent instances in PROD (500 such requests in past 7 days) look for problem ID: `System.Runtime.InteropServices.COMException at NuGetGallery.ApiController.ReadPackageFromRequest`.

This 500 shows up in our failure reporting even though it was not a failure witnessed by the user and is not caused by our app or our dependencies.

### Additional context

It seems like we can detect this case with `Response.IsClientConnected`.
https://stackoverflow.com/a/12386676

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Pushing packages with --skip-duplicate still updates snupkg" (#9647) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
When uploading packages with `--skip-duplicate` duplicate `nupkg` packages are skipped, but symbol packages are uploaded again. 

You can take a look at this script from GitHub Actions which causes this behavior.

https://github.com/PiranhaCMS/piranha.core/blob/master/.github/workflows/publish_to_nuget.yml

Best regards

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ValidateTimestampResponse doesn't work correctly if nonce got normalized" (#9536) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
ValidateTimestampResponse doesn't work correctly if the generated nonce is different after normaliztion.
This will bring in flaky test, and also product issue: when requesting for timestamping, it may fail for nonces did not match.

Test TimestampSignatureAsync_TimestampingCountersignature_SucceedsAsync failed for:
Error message:
`NuGet.Packaging.Signing.TimestampException : The timestamp response is invalid. Nonces did not match.`

Stack trace
```
 at NuGet.Packaging.Signing.Rfc3161TimestampProvider.ValidateTimestampResponse(Byte[] nonce, Byte[] messageHash, IRfc3161TimestampToken timestampToken) in /Users/runner/runners/2.166.4/work/1/s/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Packaging/Signing/Timestamp/Rfc3161TimestampProvider.cs:line 211
   at NuGet.Packaging.Signing.Rfc3161TimestampProvider.GetTimestampAsync(TimestampRequest request, ILogger logger, CancellationToken token) in /Users/runner/runners/2.166.4/work/1/s/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Packaging/Signing/Timestamp/Rfc3161TimestampProvider.cs:line 126
   at NuGet.Packaging.Signing.Rfc3161TimestampProvider.TimestampSignatureAsync(PrimarySignature primarySignature, TimestampRequest request, ILogger logger, CancellationToken token) in /Users/runner/runners/2.166.4/work/1/s/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Packaging/Signing/Timestamp/Rfc3161TimestampProvider.cs:line 69
   at NuGet.Packaging.FuncTest.TimestampProviderTests.TimestampSignatureAsync_TimestampingCountersignature_SucceedsAsync() in /Users/runner/runners/2.166.4/work/1/s/test/NuGet.Core.FuncTests/NuGet.Packaging.FuncTest/SigningTests/TimestampProviderTests.cs:line 474
--- End of stack trace from previous location ---
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Pack library with analyzer" (#9106) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
If we have:

```
Lib.csproj
Lib.Analyzers.csproj
```

And we want to pack so that `Lib.nupkg` has a package dependency on `Lib.Analyzers.nupkg`

An example of the desired result is: [Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Common](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Common/) that has a dependency on [Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers/)

For anyone familiar with paket it is done like this using paket:

```
dependencies
  Lib.Analyzers
```

In `paket.template`

Is there support for this scenario and if so where is it documented?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Adding tests for xplat verification in Dotnet.Integration.Test" (#9287) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
When we ship xplat verification, we will insert the verification bits into dotnet. Then the dotnet restore will have the verification process. 

For now, we only have 1 test in Dotnet.Integration.Test.DotnetRestoreTests `DotnetRestore_WithAuthorSignedPackage_Succeeds`, which is making sure even if there is no xplat verification, the dotnet restore will work correctly with signed packages. 

So the coverage is not enough. 

We need to add tests for xplat verification in Dotnet.Integration.Test.
The following scenarios may needs to be considered:
1.unsigned package with "signatureValidationMode=require"
2.most representative type of  signed package on NuGet.org  with "signatureValidationMode=require"

For now, the Dotnet.Integration.Test.DotnetRestoreTests  only runs on windows. We may need to discuss with the team, to consider to run it on Linux or Mac.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Enable test GetCertificateChain_WithUntrustedRoot_Throws on Mac and fix it " (#9495) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The test `GetCertificateChain_WithUntrustedRoot_Throws` is enabled on Mac in https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3275
But the assertion didn't check for MacOS. So we should change the assertion to check the results on Mac and fix it.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Package with runtime native dll in "win" folder not copied to output" (#9648) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I have a package with the structure
```
lib
|- net45
|  |- some managed dlls
runtimes
|- win
   |- native
      |- some natives dlls
```
When I consume this nuget from a c# .NetFramework project that target `AnyCPU` it copy the natives dlls to the output as expected. But if the c# project target `x64` then they are not copied.

From my understanding of the documentation here: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/core/rid-catalog#rid-graph
>When NuGet restores packages, it tries to find an exact match for the specified runtime. If an exact match is not found, NuGet walks back the graph until it finds the closest compatible system according to the RID graph.

So it should fallback to `win` RID since it doesn't find any `win-x64` folder.

Why are the natives not copied when the project target `x64`?
I understand that generic `win` native dll is weird concept since the dll must target `x86` or `x64` not both. Is it why RID fallback graph is not apply in that case?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Pushing packages with --skip-duplicate still updates snupkg" (#9647) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
When uploading packages with `--skip-duplicate` duplicate `nupkg` packages are skipped, but symbol packages are uploaded again. 

You can take a look at this script from GitHub Actions which causes this behavior.

https://github.com/PiranhaCMS/piranha.core/blob/master/.github/workflows/publish_to_nuget.yml

Best regards

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "nuget pack doesn't ignore .git folder" (#9646) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used : NuGet.exe

NuGet version : 5.5.1

OS version : Windows Server 2016 (14393.3686) and Windows 10 1709 (16299.904)

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Clone a git repository containing files directly at the root

2. Use `nuget pack`

3. Notice that the _.git_ directory is included in the produced package

## Other details

The output of nuget.exe specifically mentions that folders starting with a dot will be ignored, so the .gitattributes file is properly ignored but the _.git_ directory is systematically included in the nupkg file.
